Indicator Name: Most recent graduate intake who are female (%)
Description: The percentage of recent graduates hired by the company/group that are female.
The percentage of senior management active at the company/group that are female.
The percentage of total employees at the company/group that are female.

Indicator Name: Length of primary parental leave, fully-paid
Description: The total length of paid maternity leave provided by the company/group; according to their maternity/paternity policy where one exists.

Indicator Name: Length of secondary parental leave, fully-paid
Description: The total length of paid parental leave provided by the company/group to 'secondary' parental figures' according to their maternity/paternity policy where one exists.
The absolute percentage difference between the median pay of a company's male and female employees. (median)
Source: Annual Report, Gender Pay Gap Report

Description: The percentage difference year on year of a company’s gender pay gap.
Source: Annual Report, Gender Pay Gap Report

Description: The proportion of a company’s board of directors that is female, not including secretaries. As there has been a historic trend of male dominated boards and the relative few numbers of people on a board we have made the decision that the larger proportion the better.
Source: Annual Report, Gender Pay Gap Report

Indicator Name: New directors appointed who are female (%)
Description: The proportion of recent hires (since 2016) of directors to a company’s board. Given that very few of the FTSE 100 boards were evenly proportioned, and that the highest hiring proportion is 75% we have decided that the higher hiring proportion the better.
